verses.verse: Now<WG3767> when Festus<WG5347> had come<WG1910> into the province<WG1885>, after<WG3326> three<WG5140> days<WG2250> he ascended<WG305> from<WG575> Cæsarea<WG2542> to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414>.
Then<WG1161> the high priest<WG749> and<WG2532> the chief<WG4413> of the Jews<WG2453> informed<WG1718> him<WG846> against<WG2596> Paul<WG3972>, and<WG2532> begged<WG3870> him<WG846>,

And asking<WG154> a favor<WG5485> against<WG2596> him<WG846>, that<WG3704> he would summon<WG3343> him<WG846> to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2419>, laying<WG4160> wait<WG1747> in<WG2596> the way<WG3598> to kill<WG337> him<WG846>.

But<WG3767><WG99999> Festus<WG5347> answered<WG611>, that Paul<WG3972> should<WG3195> be kept<WG5083> at<WG1722> Cæsarea<WG2542>, and<WG1161> that he himself<WG1438> would go<WG1607><WG99999> there shortly<WG5034>.

Let them<WG3588> therefore<WG3767>, said he<WG5346>, which<WG3588> among<WG1722> you<WG5213> are able<WG1415>, go down with<WG4782> me<WG846>, and accuse this<WG2723> man<WG5129>, if<WG1487> there is<WG2076> any<WG5100> wickedness<WG1722> in<WG3588> him<WG846>.

And<WG1161> when he had stayed<WG1304> among<WG1722> them<WG846> more<WG4119> than<WG2228> ten<WG1176> days<WG2250>, he went down<WG2597> to<WG1519> Cæsarea<WG2542>; and the next day<WG1887> sitting<WG2523> on<WG1909> the judgment seat<WG968> commanded<WG2753> Paul<WG3972> to be brought<WG71>.

And<WG1161> when<WG3854> he<WG846> had come<WG3854>, the Jews<WG2453> which<WG3588> came down<WG2597> from<WG575> Jerusalem<WG2414> stood round about<WG4026>, and laid<WG5342> many<WG4183><WG99999> severe<WG926> complaints<WG157> against<WG2596> Paul<WG3972>, which<WG3739> they could<WG2480> not<WG3756> prove<WG584>.

While<WG3754> he answered<WG626> for himself<WG846>, Neither<WG3777> against<WG1519> the law<WG3551> of the Jews<WG2453>, nor<WG3777> against<WG1519> the temple<WG2411>, nor yet<WG3777> against<WG1519> Cæsar<WG2541>, have I sinned<WG264> at all<WG5100>.

But<WG1161> Festus<WG5347>, willing<WG2309> to do<WG2698> the Jews<WG2453> a favor<WG5485>, answered<WG611> Paul<WG3972>, and said<WG2036>, Will you<WG2309> go up<WG305> to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414>, and there<WG1563> be judged<WG2919> of<WG4012> these things<WG5130> before<WG1909> me<WG1700>?

Then<WG1161> said<WG2036> Paul<WG3972>, I<WG1510> stand<WG2476> at<WG1909> Cæsar<WG2541>'s judgment seat<WG968>, where<WG3757> I<WG3165> should<WG1163> to be judged<WG2919>: to the Jews<WG2453> have I done<WG91> no<WG3762> wrong<WG91>, as<WG5613><WG99999> you<WG4771> very well<WG2566> know<WG1921>.

For<WG1063> if<WG1487><WG99999> I be an offender<WG91>, or<WG2532> have committed<WG4238> any thing<WG5100> worthy<WG514> of death<WG2288>, I refuse<WG3868> not<WG3756> to die<WG599>: but<WG1161> if<WG1487> there be<WG2076> none<WG3762> of these things whereof<WG3739> these<WG3778> accuse<WG2723> me<WG3450>, no man<WG3762> may<WG1410> deliver<WG5483> me<WG3165> unto them<WG846>. I appeal unto<WG1941> Cæsar<WG2541>.

Then<WG5119> Festus<WG5347>, when he had conferred<WG4814> with<WG3326> the council<WG4824>, answered<WG611>, Have you appealed<WG1941> unto Cæsar<WG2541>? Unto<WG1909> Cæsar<WG2541> shall you go<WG4198>.
And<WG1161> after<WG1230> certain<WG5100> days<WG2250> king<WG935> Agrippa<WG67> and<WG2532> Bernice<WG959> came<WG2658> unto<WG1519> Cæsarea<WG2542> to greet<WG782> Festus<WG5347>.

And<WG1161> when<WG5613> they had been<WG1304> there<WG1563> many<WG4119> days<WG2250>, Festus<WG5347> declared<WG394> Paul<WG3972>'s cause<WG2596> unto the king<WG935>, saying<WG3004>, There is<WG2076> a certain<WG5100> man<WG435> left<WG2641> in bonds<WG1198> by<WG5259> Felix<WG5344>:

About<WG4012> whom<WG3739>, when I<WG3450> was<WG1096> at<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414>, the chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> the elders<WG4245> of the Jews<WG2453> informed<WG1718> me<WG154>, desiring to have judgment<WG1349> against<WG2596> him<WG846>.

To<WG4314> whom<WG3739> I answered<WG3754>, It is<WG2076> not<WG3756> the manner<WG1485> of the Romans<WG4514> to deliver<WG5483> any<WG5100> man<WG444> to<WG1519> die<WG684>, before<WG4250><WG99999> he which<WG3588> is accused<WG2723> has<WG2192> met the accusers<WG2725> face<WG4383> to<WG2596> face<WG4383>, and<WG5037> has<WG2983> opportunity<WG5117> to answer for himself<WG627> concerning<WG4012> the crime laid against him<WG1462>.

Therefore<WG3767>, when they<WG846> had come<WG4905> here<WG1759>, without<WG3367><WG99999> any delay<WG311> on the next day<WG1836> I sat<WG2523> on<WG1909> the judgment seat<WG968>, and commanded<WG2753> the man<WG435> to be brought forth<WG71>.
Against<WG4012> whom<WG3739> when the accusers<WG2725> stood up<WG2476>, they brought<WG2018> no<WG3762> accusation<WG156> of such things<WG3739> as I<WG1473> supposed<WG5282>:

But<WG1161> had<WG2192> certain<WG5100> questions<WG2213> against<WG4314> him<WG846> concerning<WG4012> their own<WG2398> superstition<WG1175>, and<WG2532> of<WG4012> one<WG5100> Jesus<WG2424>, which was dead<WG2348>, whom<WG3739> Paul<WG3972> affirmed<WG5335> to be alive<WG2198>.

And<WG1161> because<WG639> I<WG1473> doubted<WG639> concerning<WG1519> such<WG4012> manner<WG5127> of questions<WG2214>, I asked<WG3004> him whether<WG1487> he would<WG1014> go<WG4198> to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2419>, and there<WG2546> be judged<WG2919> of<WG4012> these matters<WG5130>.

But<WG1161> when Paul<WG3972> had appealed<WG1941><WG99999> to be protected<WG5083> until<WG1519> the hearing<WG1233> of Augustus<WG4575>, I commanded<WG2753> him<WG846> to be kept<WG5083> until<WG2193><WG99999> I might send<WG3992> him<WG846> to<WG4314> Cæsar<WG2541>.

Then<WG1161> Agrippa<WG67> said<WG5346> unto<WG4314> Festus<WG5347>, I would<WG1014> also<WG2532> hear<WG191> the man<WG444> myself<WG1161>. To morrow<WG839>, said he<WG5346>, you shall hear<WG191> him<WG846>.

And<WG3767> on the next day<WG1887>, when Agrippa<WG67> had come<WG2064>, and<WG2532> Bernice<WG959>, with<WG3326> great<WG4183> pomp<WG5325>, also<WG2532> had entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the place of hearing<WG201>, with<WG4862><WG99999> the chief captains<WG5506>, and<WG2532> principal<WG1851><WG99999> men<WG435> of the city<WG4172>, at<WG2596> Festus<WG5347>' <WG2532> commandment<WG2753> Paul<WG3972> was brought forth<WG71>.

And<WG2532> Festus<WG5347> said<WG5346>, King<WG935> Agrippa<WG67>, and<WG2532> all men<WG3956> which<WG3588> are here present<WG4840> with us<WG2254>, you see<WG2334> this<WG5126> man<WG435>, about<WG4012> whom<WG3739> all<WG3956> the multitude<WG4128> of the Jews<WG2453> have petitioned<WG1793> me<WG3427>, both<WG5037> at<WG1722> Jerusalem<WG2414>, and<WG2532> also here<WG1759>, crying that<WG1916> he<WG846> should<WG1163> not<WG3361> live<WG2198> any longer<WG3371>.

But<WG1161> when I<WG1473> found<WG2638> that he<WG846> had committed<WG4238> nothing<WG3367> worthy<WG514> of death<WG2288>, and<WG2532> that he<WG5127><WG99999> himself<WG846> has appealed to<WG1941> Augustus<WG4575>, I have determined<WG2919> to send<WG3992> him<WG846>.

Of<WG4012> whom<WG3739> I have<WG2192> no<WG3756> certain<WG804> thing<WG5100> to write<WG1125> unto my lord<WG2962>. Therefore<WG1352> I have brought<WG4254> him<WG846> forth<WG4254> before<WG1909> you<WG5216>, and<WG2532> specially<WG3122> before<WG1909> you<WG4675>, O king<WG935> Agrippa<WG67>, that<WG3704>, after examination<WG351> had<WG1096>, I might have<WG2192> something<WG5100> to write<WG1125>.
For<WG1063> it seems<WG1380> to me<WG3427> unreasonable<WG249> to send<WG3992> a prisoner<WG1198>, <WG2532> without<WG3361> signifying<WG4591> the crimes<WG156> charged against<WG2596> him<WG846>.
